item.title: 葡萄牙将于 10 月 6 日任命佩雷拉为中央银行行长
item.description: 葡萄牙财政部表示，将于 10 月 6 日正式任命阿尔瓦罗-桑托斯-佩雷拉（Alvaro Santos Pereira）为新任央行行长。【原文：Portugal’s Finance Ministry said it will formally present Alvaro Santos Pereira as its new central bank governor on Oct. 6.】

item.title: 美国资金短缺加剧危机，联合国大幅削减索马里粮食援助
item.description: 由于资金严重短缺，联合国粮食机构将把接受紧急救生援助的索马里人数量减少三分之二以上。【原文：The United Nations’ food agency will cut the number of Somalis receiving lifesaving emergency aid by more than two-thirds amid a critical funding shortfall.】

item.title: 据说汇丰又将失去一位中东地区顶级 IPO 银行家
item.description: 汇丰控股公司中东欧、中东和非洲股票资本市场主管即将离职，这是汇丰银行进行全面改革后的最新离职。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc’s head of equity capital markets for Central and Eastern Europe, Middle East and Africa is set to leave, the latest departure as the lender undergoes a sweeping overhaul.】

item.title: 波兰计划出售创纪录的季度兹罗提债券，因为债务在增加
item.description: 波兰政府计划在本季度发行比以往更多的本币债券，这是在内阁警告公共债务不断增长之后，对投资者持续需求的信心信号。【原文：Poland’s government plans to offer more local-currency bonds than ever this quarter in a sign of confidence over continued investor demand after the cabinet warned about growing public debt.】

item.title: 先锋的竞争对手终于拿到了其减税基金设计方案
item.description: 二十多年来，美国的基金经理们一直羡慕地看着先锋集团（Vanguard Group）从一种独特的结构中获益，这种结构将 ETF 的优势嫁接到其最大的共同基金上。这种设计受到专利保护，为投资者节省了数十亿美元，并帮助杰克-博格尔（Jack Bogle）创立的公司成长为价值 11 万亿美元的巨头。【原文：For more than two decades, US money managers have looked on enviously as Vanguard Group reaped the benefits of a unique structure that grafted the advantages of an ETF onto its biggest mutual funds. The design, protected by patent, saved its investors billions of dollars and helped the Jack Bogle-founded firm grow into an $11 trillion giant.】

item.title: 原油价格疲软，卢布坚挺，俄罗斯石油收入减少五分之一
item.description: 由于全球原油价格下跌和国家货币升值，俄罗斯 9 月份用于国家预算的石油收入与去年同期相比减少了五分之一。【原文：Russia’s oil proceeds going to the state budget shrank by a fifth in September compared with a year earlier, following a drop in global crude prices and a strengthening of the nation’s currency.】

item.title: 特朗普在关门游戏中停止向芝加哥交通局拨款 20 亿美元
item.description: 白宫预算主任拉塞尔-沃特（Russell Vought）宣布，特朗普政府将扣留 20 多亿美元用于芝加哥的交通项目，这是白宫利用停摆作为杠杆缩小联邦政府规模的最新举措。【原文：White House Budget Director Russell Vought announced that the Trump administration is withholding more than $2 billion for transportation projects in Chicago, the latest move by the White House to use the shutdown as leverage to shrink the federal government.】

item.title: 意大利财政部长称欧洲央行应降息提振经济
item.description: 意大利财政部长吉安卡洛-乔盖蒂（Giancarlo Giorgetti）表示，欧洲央行应降低借贷成本，以帮助欧元区经济。【原文：The European Central Bank should reduce borrowing costs to help the euro-area economy, Italian Finance Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti said.】

item.title: 美国银行的雷德勒预计欧洲股市将下跌超过 10
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，由于投资者可能低估了经济疲软的威胁，未来几个月欧洲股市有可能下挫超过 10%。【原文：European equities risk sinking more than 10% in the coming months as investors are likely underestimating the threat of a weaker economy, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 默茨敦促德国人接受变革，否则经济将下滑
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨周五恳求德国人要么接受令人不舒服的改革，要么眼睁睁地看着经济衰退。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz on Friday implored Germans to either embrace uncomfortable reforms or watch their economy fade.】

item.title: 伯克希尔哈撒韦公司在石化行业低迷中看到希望
item.description:
以 97 亿美元的价格收购西方石油公司的化工部门，是巴菲特的一个机会主义举措。【原文：

Buying Occidental Petroleum’s chemical division for $9.7 billion is an opportunistic move straight from Warren Buffett’s playbook. 

】

item.title: Wunsch 称欧洲央行利率处于实现稳定通胀的有利位置
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员皮埃尔-旺施（Pierre Wunsch）表示，欧洲中央银行的政策设置是适当的，可以确保消费者价格在中期内按照2%的目标上涨。【原文：The European Central Bank’s policy settings are appropriate to ensure consumer prices are rising in line with the 2% target in the medium term, according to Governing Council member Pierre Wunsch.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利押注英镑明年创脱欧后新高
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）押注，英镑将在英国 11 月预算案公布后反弹，并在明年创下十年新高。【原文：Morgan Stanley is betting that the pound will rally after the UK’s November budget to hit a decade-high next year.】

item.title: OpenAI 的 Sora 视频应用程序加剧了错误信息的风险
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，Rachel Metz 报道 OpenAI 的 Sora 视频生成器成为社交媒体应用程序后的使用体验。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Rachel Metz reports on the experience of using OpenAI’s Sora video generator now that it’s become a social media app.】

item.title: 贝森特押注阿根廷，著名的英镑交易出现逆转
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们关注美国财政部部长对阿根廷的承诺。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the US Treasury chief’s pledge to Argentina. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 谷歌想要超级智能 AI。首先要打败青少年数学天才
item.description:
在国际数学奥林匹克竞赛中，Google的人工智能与数百名人类一起攻克了一道道难题，即使是最聪明的人也难不倒他们。【原文：

At the International Math Olympiad, Google’s AI joined hundreds of humans working through problems designed to stump even the brightest minds.

】

item.title: 次级信贷问题令消费贷款公司股价下跌
item.description: 在美国经济韧性十足的表象下，消费信贷领域的一系列小冲击共同震撼了那些为经济最脆弱的美国人提供服务的公司。【原文：Beneath the surface of what’s been a remarkably resilient US economy, a series of small shocks in the world of consumer credit have combined to rock companies that service the most financially vulnerable Americans.】

item.title: 印度央行将卢比全球化的举措考验印度市场深度
item.description: 随着美国惩罚性关税对印度货币和贸易前景造成压力，印度正在推出减少对美元依赖的长期计划。【原文：India is rolling out long-term plans to reduce dependence on the dollar, as punishing US tariffs weigh on the nation’s currency and trade prospects.】

item.title: 瑞士央行的黄金囤积为因美元暴跌而缩水的盈利带来福音
item.description: 瑞士国家银行的黄金囤积大大提高了其收益，增加了再次向政府派息的机会。【原文：The Swiss National Bank’s gold hoard is driving a significant boost to its earnings, increasing the chance of another payout to the government.】

item.title: 加纳无线公司采取行动吸收陷入困境的竞争对手的用户
item.description: 加纳第二大电信公司 Telecel 正寻求从陷入困境的国营竞争对手手中抢夺 300 万客户，以巩固自己的地位。【原文：Telecel, Ghana’s second-largest telecommunications company, is looking to solidify its position by taking on 3 million customers from a distressed state-run competitor.】

item.title: 据说信实正在与银行就创纪录的 Jio IPO 举行会谈
item.description: 熟知内情的人士称，信实工业有限公司已开始与银行就其子公司信实吉奥信息通信有限公司（Reliance Jio Infocomm Ltd.）可能上市一事进行非正式会谈，这笔交易可能会打破印度有史以来最大的首次公开募股纪录。【原文：Reliance Industries Ltd. has begun informal talks with banks about the potential listing of its unit Reliance Jio Infocomm Ltd., people familiar with the matter said, a deal that could eclipse the record for India’s biggest-ever initial public offering.】

item.title: 今年金股的热度超过一些人工智能游戏
item.description:
随着金银飙升，矿业股的表现超过芯片股，创下历史新高。【原文：

Miners have outperformed chip stocks by a record amount as bullion surges.

】

item.title: 纽约联储威廉姆斯表示，美联储使用资产负债表并非非常规做法
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）反驳了中央银行通过资产负债表政策影响经济时诉诸非常规工具的观点。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams argued against the idea that central banks are resorting to unconventional tools when they seek to influence the economy through balance sheet policies.】

item.title: 美银美林哈特内特推荐资源类、英国股票押注人工智能
item.description: 美国银行公司（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，投资者可以将人工智能股票与大宗商品股等与经济相关的廉价股票混合持有，从而更好地应对人工智能热潮。【原文：Investors can best play the artificial intelligence frenzy by mixing AI names with holdings of cheaper stocks linked to the economy, like commodities shares, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 朝日警告称啤酒厂因攻击瘫痪数据丢失
item.description: 朝日集团控股有限公司（Asahi Group Holdings Ltd.）首次披露了网络攻击者使用勒索软件导致其国内工厂停工并可能窃取数据的情况，这进一步揭示了一起网络漏洞事件，该事件引发了人们对该国安全防范措施的质疑。【原文：Asahi Group Holdings Ltd. revealed for the first time that cyber-attackers used ransomware to bring its domestic factories to a standstill and potentially stole data, shedding more light on an online breach that’s raised questions about the country’s security preparedness.】

item.title: 日本最大反对党不排除与自民党合作的可能性
item.description: 日本最大的反对党将推动在即将到来的额外预算中纳入应税的 20,000 日元（135 美元）现金派发，该党领导人表示，这是对是否可能与执政联盟加深合作的关键考验。【原文：Japan’s largest opposition party will push for taxable ¥20,000 ($135) cash handouts to be included in the upcoming extra budget, the party leader said, framing it as a key test of whether deeper cooperation with the ruling coalition is possible.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德呼吁非银行机构接受更严格审查
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）警告说，不要降低银行监管标准，而是必须加强对非银行的审查。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde warned against lowering standards in banking regulation, arguing that scrutiny of non-banks must be strengthened instead.】

item.title: 据报道欧盟拟转让 Strabag，Raiffeisen 股票大涨
item.description: Raiffeisen Bank International AG 的股价创下两个月来最大涨幅，原因是有报道称这家奥地利贷款机构可能获得 Strabag SE 的股份，作为其在俄罗斯被迫支付的损失赔偿。【原文：Shares of Raiffeisen Bank International AG rallied the most in two months on a report the Austrian lender may receive shares in Strabag SE as compensation for damages it was forced to pay in Russia.】

item.title: 艾米风暴袭击英国，英国电力跌至零度以下
item.description: 由于艾米风暴将在整个周末带来创纪录的风力发电量，英国电力价格两年来首次出现负增长。【原文：UK power prices turned negative for the first time in two years with Storm Amy set to deliver record wind generation through the weekend.】

item.title: 股票牛市欲罢不能，S&P涨势进入 "躁动 "区间
item.description: 股市涨势过猛的警钟敲得越响，投资者似乎就越听不进去。【原文：The louder the alarm bells are blaring about the stock-market rally getting excessive, the more investors appear to be tuning them out.】
